newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka opens stronger vs dollar.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka opens stronger vs dollar.

text.p: The Bangladesh taka opened firmer at 43.7490/7550 to the dollar in interbank trading on Sunday with some foreign banks responding to demands from importers, dealers said.
"Supply (of dollar) seems to have improved compared to past several sessions. Some banks, which have gone long on dollar, are willing to offload," said one dealer.
The interbank call money rates opened mostly steady at nine to 10 percent against eight to 11 percent the day before.
